metadata.title: CVE-2024-40937 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:gve: Clear napi->skb before dev_kfree_skb_any()gve_rx_free_skb incorrectly leaves napi->skb referencing an skb after itis freed with dev_kfree_skb_any(). This can result in a subsequent callto napi_get_frags returning a dangling pointer.Fix this by clearing napi->skb before the skb is freed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-40937` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.1').
